meanings.definition: A continuous line of planking or plates on the hull of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The strakes along the ship's side helped it stay strong in the rough sea.
meanings.sent2: The wooden strakes on the hull of the boat were painted a bright blue.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on one of the strakes and pretended to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: The strakes of the ship were like protective shields, guarding it from the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the golden light reflected off the strakes, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A strip of metal or wood used to reinforce or support a structure.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers added extra strakes to the bridge to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The wooden strakes were carefully placed along the walls to provide additional support.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the metal strake as a balance beam in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the strake that held her together during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The old house creaked, but the strakes held it steady through the storm.

meanings.definition: To install or fit with strakes.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will strake the new shelves into place in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She strakes the metal sheets onto the roof to protect it from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to strake the new knives on the magnetic strip for easy access.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to strake her heart, leaving her feeling vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully straked the pieces of glass together to create a stunning mosaic.
